comment: I enjoyed this professor's 1101 course so much that I took him again for 1102! He encourages you to ask for feedback on your work and then provides very helpful critiques. There is extra credit opportunities for almost every assignment. Just show up when you know you have to and this class will pass easily. He tries his best to remember names too.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: He's the best, like seriously. I took him for 1101 and now 1102. Both classes had three papers, and a small presentation. You turn in three drafts and three final drafts. He gives extra credit for getting feedback from him or the writing center. He let us leave early or have non-mandatory classes. Super laid back guy, would take him again.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: ONLY take him if you have to. he grades extremely harsh but takes unlimited feedback help so take advantage of that!! don't procrastinate!! complete every assignment as early as you can and email it to him so he can revise it he is SUCH a harsh grader but he'll work with you if you get it done early
If a 0 star review was possible. This would be it. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS IF U VALUE UR LIFE AND MENTAL HEALTH

do NOT take this professor whatever u do. he critiques every single sentence in a paper even if u follow the guidelines. he also NEVER has time to give feedback and he expects u to figure everything out on ur own. he is NO help and he genuinely never gave me a good grade. i failed EVERYTHING so I withdrew. if u don't love ur life take him.

Always marked my papers off for like 20 things and then gave me B's. Hated the way we had to email our papers to submit them and the time to complete the papers felt pretty short. Many weeks the assignment was “finish x, submit x”. No random assignment so always working on papers. Peer review was a big thing. Pretty good break from hard classes.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: You have very few grades (3 papers total with a rough and final draft for each), but he makes his rubric very clear on what he is looking for. You should get an A pretty easily, his feedback on the rough drafts is really clear and he wants you to succeed!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Schmidt was a great professor for a new freshman. Only problem was we weren't really taught how to do specific forms of writing.

He does not allow smartphones, headphones to be used during class. Just know that. First of all, this is not high school anymore. I don't know why he has such a high rating. He is lowkey rude to the students and swears he knows everything since he's been at KSU for 25 years. He says no Ai and if he can't legally prove you used AI, bad grade anyway!

I loved this professor. The class has 3 papers, grades on the rough and final draft. He gives really good feedback when you get your draft back. He also gives extra credit if you ask for feedback before the due date. Attendance was optional some days, and he lets us out of class early. Nice guy and clear with expectations. Easy class overall.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: i have no idea how this man's rating is so high. do NOT take this class.

Professor Schmidt was my favorite professor this semester. There are only three main papers per semester with a first and final draft on each. He provides extra credit opportunities throughout the semester on all drafts, which is just asking for feedback. If you do the extra credit you will get the feedback needed to get an A on all drafts.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Schmidt wants you to pass. There are 3 papers total, each of which you have to submit a draft, final, and peer review. You do not have to attend open classes. You MUST be ON TIME to all other classes, or it will effect your grade. Provides unlimited feedback requests, so if you do that, you are pretty much guaranteed an A.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Amazing professor! Would definitely take him again! Grade is based off of both rough and final drafts of a discussion paper, annotated bibliography, final researched paper & peer review & reflection. Offers extra credit points if you ask for feedback on your papers from him or the writing center. He answers any questions you have thoroughly

its not very hard, but the grade is entirely based on papers and he is a tough grader. guidelines for the papers are vague which makes it even harder to get good feedback. you can only submit papers by emailing him through d2l which is annoying

I took Professor Schmidt for English 1101 and 1102 and he was the best instructor I've had so far. He provides grading rubrics and resources that make it easy to receive passing grades on essays. He sends out all the information you'll need to know ahead of time, and gives enough time for assignments to be completed. He was very kind & helpful.
A good teacher can grade harshly and be vague with what he wants on papers but still, he is a good teacher who is always available for questions and can give feedback if asked.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Assignment guidelines are so vague, that he has to send 20 emails before the deadline (usually almost one daily) to clarify details that several others already emailed him about. Not only are his emails super long, they don't really help either. Never know what he actually wants from an assignment. Grades very harshly for an 1102 class.
He is one of the worst professor I had at KSU. He was so tough on grading work, never explained his work correctly.

The class primarily revolved around writing papers. His feedback was overwhelming, and less helpful than I hoped. Felt like the papers weren't mine anymore, was frustrating. I spent excessive time trying to perfect the papers to meet his expectations. He did give opportunities for extra credit. I still received good grade overall.

He was a great professor! We only had 3 papers and each one had a draft too, but if you submitted for feedback, you got extra credit AND feedback. I was able to do great on the 1st paper, so I took it easy on the 2nd paper and still maintained my A. The topic for the papers/research was easy too.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Schmidt it is one of the best English professors ever! He is very professional and know what it is in his content, He is always there for you and works with you if you have any difficulties, He is awesome, Very recommended.

I had to write a research paper for this class and did everything the night before every due date.  He gives very clear feedback. You get 3 extra credit points for every draft if you go to the writing center or send him your draft. He was never condescending in his critiques and is easily one of the best English teachers I have ever had.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: So happy I took his class. You wrote one very involved, detailed research essay (mine ended up being 11 pages). However, you write in pieces and each time; you have the option of sending your drafts for his revisions and you get extra credit. He made his class so easy and I learned a lot. 100% recommend!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I'm kinda sad I never got to actually meet Professor Schmidt because his course was not only super convenient, but he also gives great and effective feedback. His expectations for each assignment are very clear and gives a good amount of time for big writing assignments.

If you are an International student do not take his class. I passed my Eng 2100 class with a good grade but failed his Eng 1102 Class. He is a tough grader and does not accept any excuses. He speaks English for almost 70 years and he thinks that you should be on his level, good in person but not recommend
He is a very nice person and cares about if you understand the material or not. He is not a tough grader and he always gives feedback. I really liked him.

i really like professor David, i am a exchange student here and taking his english 1102 cause, he always explain things very clear and make sure everyone understand. He shares a lot his own experience about how to learn english. He is the best.

Professor Schmidt is one of the kindest teachers I've ever had. He is extremely humble, accepting, and available for help. He also provides other opportunities to get help, if needed. He is also an easy grader; if you do what you're supposed to do, and if you turn it in on time, you will get an A in Professor Schmidt's class.

Professor Schmidt is by far the greatest professors i have taken. He is intelligent, kind, understanding, and extremely helpful. In his classes you actually learn; and after you are left with a great memory for the rest of your life. He becomes your friend.He really cares. Awesome professor and person in general!B/se of him i love reading & writing
He's a pretty fair grader. As long as you do your work on time, you'll be okay in his class. Funny and nice guy.

I took his honors class and he was great! There is a lot of work but he is very clear about what he expects and he is very helpful! He is very sweet and always available. He is a very fair grader and as long as you DO the work, you should be fine. If you work for an A, you will get it.
Not an easy class. Not an understanding professor.
Avoid this class at all cost.
Do yourself a favor, DO NOT TAKE HIM

he is one of the worst instructors in ksu , if u r late a couple mins he criticize u about it & he takes of points of ur grad for everything , he might even take points of if u blink , DO NOT TAKE HIM
Great Teacher! Great Man!!! Great class!!! He is always available!

He is really great. Reminds me of the perfect teachers from the movies - helpful, intelligent, well organized, clear, funny, open-minded, his classes r interesting, and everything seems to make sense. Gives good feedback on the essays.
THE BEST!!! He is very clear, his classes are never boring and he is always ready to help!
He is the best English teacher I ever had!

Professor Schmidt is one of my most favorite teachers at KSU. Of all the teachers I've had had so far, he is the best. He is always helpful and friendly, and will deal with any issues that comes up. He is awesome
He is really hot, nice, calm and above all helpful teacher.
He is really helpful and awesome.

One of my favorite teachers at Kennesaw! Extremely nice, helpful and just a great guy all around! I would take my papers to him for every class, even after I didn't have him and he would help me correct them. As long as you set-up an appointment with him, he will help you with just about anything! I highly reccomend him, he is a great teacher!
great person, teacher, friend, easy classes.

I loved him he was awsome. He helped me with anything that I needed. He wasn't rediculously hard to please at all. His assignments were very understandable. He is cares about his students unlike most of the teachers at Kennesaw.

I loved this teacher! He is absolutley amazing, he will help you with anything and if you are a decent write you can definitley make an A! He is by far my favorite teacher at KSU, I would take every class taught by him! You will not regret taking this class

He's an awesome teacher.  As you get into the semester, he will give you a few controversial topics of your choice to write about and he has you prepare five minute presentations on broad fields that he will ask you to pick a specific issue on.  He is very fun, easy, and helps you to find and establish grounds on your own opinions.

TAKE THIS TEACHER!!!! I hated english before i took him, and not that I like it now but, he made every thing very clear... I was never left unsure about what to do... very very helpful and as long as you do the work its an easy, but earned for, a!
very good teacher, he is a very patient man. if you dont like English he makes you like it, he makes the class very interesting too.
Great teacher. explains well, gives goreat feedback, and always willing to help no matter what time of the day. sympathetic to your needs.
very softspoken man,mainly wrote papers and a couple presentations, so sweet & helpful & pretty laidback
